About FBref.com

FBref.com launched (June 13, 2018) with domestic league coverage for England, France, Germany, Italy, Spain, and United States. Since then we have been steadily expanding our coverage to include domestic leagues from over 40 countries as well as domestic cup, super cup and youth leagues from top European countries. We have also added coverage for major international cups such as the UEFA Champions League and Copa Libertadores.

FBref is the most complete sources for women's football data on the internet. This includes the entire history of the FIFA Women's World Cup as well as recent domestic league seasons from nine countries, including advanced stats like xG for most of those nine.

In collaboration with Opta, we are including advanced analytical data such as xG, xA, progressive passing, duels and more for over twenty competitions. For more information on the expected goals model and which competitions have advanced data, see our xG explainer.

Kenan Hasagić (* 1. Februar 1980 in Kakanj) ist ein bosnisch-herzegowinischer Fußballtorhüter. (de)

Kenan Hasagic (n. 1 de febrero de 1980 (42 años) Kakanj) es un futbolista bosnio que juega de portero. Su carrera futbolística comenzó en su ciudad natal con la local de la primera Liga de Bosnia y Herzegovina. A la edad de 16 años, hizo su debut en un partido de primera división. Fue el portero más prometedor en Bosnia-Herzegovina, que jugó para las selecciones júnior y luego fue transferido a Austria al Vorwärts Steyr. Después de eso, él era un miembro de la Altay SK en Turquía, pero en realidad nunca consiguió un equipo de fútbol de primera. Volvió a Bosnia y jugó para Bosna Visoko. En 2003, firmó un contrato con FK Željezničar Se ha encontrado una buena forma allí e incluso se convirtió en portero de primera elección para la Selección de fútbol de Bosnia y Herzegovina. En las temporadas 2004/2005, se trasladó a Turquía una vez más en que fichó para la Liga turca, en Gaziantepspor. Fichó por el Istanbul Buyuksehir Belediyespor. Hizo su debut con el equipo nacional el 12 de febrero de 2003, en un juego entre Gales y Bosnia-Herzegovina, que terminó en un empate 2-2. (es)

Kenan Hasagić (Bosnian pronunciation: [xâsaɡitɕ]; born 1 February 1980) is a Bosnian retired professional football goalkeeper and current goalkeeping coach of Bosnian Premier League club Željezničar. (en)

Kenan Hasagić, né le 1er février 1980 à Kakanj, est un footballeur bosnien évoluant au poste de gardien de but. Il est le gardien titulaire de l'équipe de Bosnie-Herzégovine de football de 2003 à 2011. (fr)

Kenan Hasagić (Kakanj, 1º febbraio 1980) è un ex calciatore bosniaco, di ruolo portiere, attuale preparatore dei portieri del Tuzla City. (it)

Kenan Hasagić (Kakanj, 1 februari 1980) is een Bosnisch voetballer. Hij speelt als doelman bij het Turkse Istanbul Büyükşehir Belediyespor. Hasagić staat al een aantal jaren op het hoogste niveau in Turkije onder de lat. In zijn geboorteland Bosnië en Herzegovina speelde hij voor FK Željezničar en FK Rudar Kakanj. Als doelman moet hij het hebben van zijn kwaliteiten in het strafschopgebied zoals het één op één gaan in lastige situaties. (nl)

Kenan Hasagić (ur. 1 lutego 1980 w Kakanju) – piłkarz bośniacki grający na pozycji bramkarza. Od 2007 roku jest piłkarzem klubu İstanbul Büyükşehir Belediyespor. (pl)

Кенан Хасагич (сербохорв. Kenan Hasagić / Кенан Хасагић; родился 1 февраля 1980, Какань) — боснийский футболист, вратарь, тренер. (ru)

Кенан Хасагич (босн. Kenan Hasagić, нар. 1 лютого 1980, Какань, СФРЮ) — боснійський футболіст, що грав на позиції воротаря. Виступав, зокрема, за клуби , «Ґазіантепспор» та «Істанбул ББ», а також національну збірну Боснії і Герцеговини. (uk)

Date of Birth: 01-Feb-1980

Place of Birth: Kakanj, Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bosnia and Herzegovina

Profession: association football player

Nationality: Bosnia and Herzegovina

Zodiac Sign: Aquarius

Kenan Hasagić ( Bosnian pronunciation: [xâsaɡitɕ]; born 1 February 1980) is a Bosnian retired professional football goalkeeper[1] and current goalkeeping coach of Bosnian Premier League club Željezničar.

Club career [ edit ]

Hasagić's football career began in his hometown with Rudar Kakanj. At the age of 16, he made his debut in a first division match. He concedeed 5 goals. He was the most promising goalkeeper in Bosnia and Herzegovina, he played for youth selections and was later transferred to Austrian side Vorwärts Steyr.

After that, Hasagić was a member of Altay in Turkey but didn't see much first team football. He went back to Bosnia and played for Rudar Kakanj and Bosna Visoko. In 2003, he signed a contract with Željezničar. Here he found good form and even became first choice goalkeeper for the Bosnia and Herzegovina national team.

During the 2004–05 season, he moved to Turkey once again where he signed for Turkish Süper Lig side Gaziantepspor. In 2007, he moved over to another Turkish Süper Lig side in İstanbul Başakşehir. In 2012, Hasagić retired from football early after injuries shattered his career.

International career [ edit ]

Hasagić made his debut for Bosnia and Herzegovina in a September 2002 European Championship qualification match against Romania and has earned a total of 44 caps, scoring no goals.[2] His final international was an October 2011 European Championship qualification match against France.[3]

Managerial career [ edit ]

In August 2017, Hasagić became the new goalkeeping coach of Bosnian Premier League club Mladost Doboj Kakanj.[4] Two years later, on 2 November 2019, he announced that he left Mladost and that he will only be focusing on the Bosnia and Herzegovina national team.[5]

On 4 January 2018, after Robert Prosinečki was named the new head coach of the Bosnia and Herzegovina national team, it was announced that Hasagić became the new goalkeeping coach of the national team.[6] Hasagić left the national team in November 2019 with the sacking of Prosinečki.[7]

It was announced on 7 January 2020 that Hasagić took over the position of goalkeeping coach of another Bosnian Premier League club, Tuzla City, working alongside former national team teammate, good friend, and godfather Elvir Baljić, the club manager at the time.[8] He decided to leave the club in June 2021.[9]

On 9 July 2021, Hasagić became the new goalkeeping coach of his former club Željezničar.[10]

Personal life [ edit ]

In 1998, Hasagić met his future wife, Dijana, in Jablanica. They were married in 2000. They have three daughters together: Ilda, Iman and Inam. On 27 December 2009, Hasagić confirmed he divorced his wife Dijana after 9 years of marriage.

After his divorce, he has been in a long term relationship with a model, Aminka Sivac. He is 15 years older than her.[11] On 8 July 2019, Hasagić married Sivac. Former national team teammate Elvir Baljić was the best man at his wedding.[12]

Kenan Hasagić (born February 1 , 1980 in Kakanj ) is a Bosnian football goalkeeper .

His football career began in his hometown with the local FK Rudar. At the age of 16, he made his debut in a first division match. He was the most promising goalkeeper in Bosnia-Herzegovina, he played for junior selections and was later transferred to Austria n side Vorwärts Steyr. After that, he was a member of Altay SK in Turkey but never actually secured a first team football. He went back to Bosnia and played for Bosna Visoko. In 2003, he signed a contract with FK Željezničar . Although he spent only two seasons there, he will be remembered as the best goalkeeper in league, and one of the best in club's history. He has found a good form there and even became first choice goalkeeper for Bosnian national team. In 2004/2005 season, he moved to Turkey once again where he signed for Turkish League side Gaziantepspor . He sign for İstanbul Büyükşehir Belediyespor .

He made his debut for national team on February 12 , 2003 . in a game between Wales and Bosnia-Herzegovina which ended in a 2-2 draw. He is very good in one-on-ones and in the air. He mainly has sharp reflexes, but can sometimes "fall asleep" and concede long range shots.

Kenan Hasagić (born 1 February 1980) is a Bosnian football goalkeeper who plays for Balıkesirspor.

His football career began in his hometown with FK Rudar. At the age of 16, he made his debut in a first division match. He was the most promising goalkeeper in Bosnia and Herzegovina, he played for youth selections and was later transferred to Austrian side Vorwärts Steyr. After that, he was a member of Altay SK in Turkey but didn't see much first team football. He went back to Bosnia and played for Bosna Visoko. In 2003, he signed a contract with FK Željezničar. Here he found good form and even became first choice goalkeeper for the Bosnian national team. In 2004–05 season, he moved to Turkey once again where he signed for Turkish Süper Lig side Gaziantepspor.

He made his debut for national team on 12 February 2003 in a game between Wales and Bosnia and Herzegovina which ended in a 2–2 draw.

Personal life

In 1998, Hasagić met his future wife, Dijana, in Jablanica. They were married in 2000. They have three daughters together: Ilda, Iman and Inam.

On 27 December 2009, Hasagić confirmed he divorced his wife after 9 years of marriage.

Kenan Hasagić (pronounced as /xâsaɡitɕ/; born 1 February 1980) is a Bosnian retired professional football goalkeeper[1] and current goalkeeping coach of Bosnian Premier League club Željezničar.

Club career

Hasagić's football career began in his hometown with Rudar Kakanj. At the age of 16, he made his debut in a first division match. He concedeed 5 goals. He was the most promising goalkeeper in Bosnia and Herzegovina, he played for youth selections and was later transferred to Austrian side Vorwärts Steyr.

After that, Hasagić was a member of Altay in Turkey but didn't see much first team football. He went back to Bosnia and played for Rudar Kakanj and Bosna Visoko. In 2003, he signed a contract with Željezničar. Here he found good form and even became first choice goalkeeper for the Bosnia and Herzegovina national team.

During the 2004–05 season, he moved to Turkey once again where he signed for Turkish Süper Lig side Gaziantepspor. In 2007, he moved over to another Turkish Süper Lig side in İstanbul Başakşehir. In 2012, Hasagić retired from football early after injuries shattered his career.

Managerial career

In August 2017, Hasagić became the new goalkeeping coach of Bosnian Premier League club Mladost Doboj Kakanj.[4] Two years later, on 2 November 2019, he announced that he left Mladost and that he will only be focusing on the Bosnia and Herzegovina national team.[5]

On 4 January 2018, after Robert Prosinečki was named the new head coach of the Bosnia and Herzegovina national team, it was announced that Hasagić became the new goalkeeping coach of the national team.[6] Hasagić left the national team in November 2019 with the sacking of Prosinečki.[7]

It was announced on 7 January 2020 that Hasagić took over the position of goalkeeping coach of another Bosnian Premier League club, Tuzla City, working alongside former national team teammate, good friend, and godfather Elvir Baljić, the club manager at the time.[8] He decided to leave the club in June 2021.[9]

On 9 July 2021, Hasagić became the new goalkeeping coach of his former club Željezničar.[10]

Personal life

In 1998, Hasagić met his future wife, Dijana, in Jablanica. They were married in 2000. They have three daughters together: Ilda, Iman and Inam. On 27 December 2009, Hasagić confirmed he divorced his wife Dijana after 9 years of marriage.

After his divorce, he has been in a long term relationship with a model, Aminka Sivac. He is 15 years older than her.[11] On 8 July 2019, Hasagić married Sivac. Former national team teammate Elvir Baljić was the best man at his wedding.[12]

Kenan Hasagic

association football player

February 1, 1980 Kakanj, Kakanj Municipality, Bosnia and Herzegovina

His football career began in his hometown with FK Rudar. At the age of 16, he made his debut in a first division match. He was the most promising goalkeeper in Bosnia and Herzegovina, he played for youth selections and was later transferred to Austrian side Vorwärts Steyr. He went back to Bosnia and played for Bosna Visoko. In 2003, he signed a contract with FK Željezničar. Here he found good form and even became first choice goalkeeper for the Bosnian national team In 2004-2005 season, he moved to Turkey once again where he signed for Turkish Süper Lig side Gaziantepspor. He made his debut for national team on 12 February 2003 in a game between Wales and Bosnia and Herzegovina which ended in a 2–2 draw.

Kenan Hasagić (born 1 February 1980) is a Bosnian football goalkeeper who plays for Balıkesirspor.

His football career began in his hometown with FK Rudar. At the age of 16, he made his debut in a first division match. He was the most promising goalkeeper in Bosnia and Herzegovina, he played for youth selections and was later transferred to Austrian side Vorwärts Steyr. After that, he was a member of Altay SK in Turkey but didn't see much first team football. He went back to Bosnia and played for Bosna Visoko. In 2003, he signed a contract with FK Željezničar. Here he found good form and even became first choice goalkeeper for the Bosnian national team. In 2004–05 season, he moved to Turkey once again where he signed for Turkish Süper Lig side Gaziantepspor.

He made his debut for national team on 12 February 2003 in a game between Wales and Bosnia and Herzegovina which ended in a 2–2 draw.

Personal life

In 1998, Hasagić met his future wife, Dijana, in Jablanica. They were married in 2000. They have three daughters together: Ilda, Iman and Inam.

On 27 December 2009, Hasagić confirmed he divorced his wife after 9 years of marriage.

Kenan Hasagić (* 1. Februar 1980 in Kakanj) ist ein bosnisch-herzegowinischer Fußballtorhüter. (de)

Kenan Hasagic (n. 1 de febrero de 1980 (42 años) Kakanj) es un futbolista bosnio que juega de portero. Su carrera futbolística comenzó en su ciudad natal con la local de la primera Liga de Bosnia y Herzegovina. A la edad de 16 años, hizo su debut en un partido de primera división. Fue el portero más prometedor en Bosnia-Herzegovina, que jugó para las selecciones júnior y luego fue transferido a Austria al Vorwärts Steyr. Después de eso, él era un miembro de la Altay SK en Turquía, pero en realidad nunca consiguió un equipo de fútbol de primera. Volvió a Bosnia y jugó para Bosna Visoko. En 2003, firmó un contrato con FK Željezničar Se ha encontrado una buena forma allí e incluso se convirtió en portero de primera elección para la Selección de fútbol de Bosnia y Herzegovina. En las temporadas 2004/2005, se trasladó a Turquía una vez más en que fichó para la Liga turca, en Gaziantepspor. Fichó por el Istanbul Buyuksehir Belediyespor. Hizo su debut con el equipo nacional el 12 de febrero de 2003, en un juego entre Gales y Bosnia-Herzegovina, que terminó en un empate 2-2. (es)

Kenan Hasagić (Bosnian pronunciation: [xâsaɡitɕ]; born 1 February 1980) is a Bosnian retired professional football goalkeeper and current goalkeeping coach of Bosnian Premier League club Željezničar. (en)

Kenan Hasagić, né le 1er février 1980 à Kakanj, est un footballeur bosnien évoluant au poste de gardien de but. Il est le gardien titulaire de l'équipe de Bosnie-Herzégovine de football de 2003 à 2011. (fr)

Kenan Hasagić (Kakanj, 1º febbraio 1980) è un ex calciatore bosniaco, di ruolo portiere, attuale preparatore dei portieri del Tuzla City. (it)

Kenan Hasagić (Kakanj, 1 februari 1980) is een Bosnisch voetballer. Hij speelt als doelman bij het Turkse Istanbul Büyükşehir Belediyespor. Hasagić staat al een aantal jaren op het hoogste niveau in Turkije onder de lat. In zijn geboorteland Bosnië en Herzegovina speelde hij voor FK Željezničar en FK Rudar Kakanj. Als doelman moet hij het hebben van zijn kwaliteiten in het strafschopgebied zoals het één op één gaan in lastige situaties. (nl)

Kenan Hasagić (ur. 1 lutego 1980 w Kakanju) – piłkarz bośniacki grający na pozycji bramkarza. Od 2007 roku jest piłkarzem klubu İstanbul Büyükşehir Belediyespor. (pl)

Кенан Хасагич (сербохорв. Kenan Hasagić / Кенан Хасагић; родился 1 февраля 1980, Какань) — боснийский футболист, вратарь, тренер. (ru)

Кенан Хасагич (босн. Kenan Hasagić, нар. 1 лютого 1980, Какань, СФРЮ) — боснійський футболіст, що грав на позиції воротаря. Виступав, зокрема, за клуби , «Ґазіантепспор» та «Істанбул ББ», а також національну збірну Боснії і Герцеговини. (uk)

association football player

February 1, 1980 Kakanj, Kakanj Municipality, Bosnia and Herzegovina

His football career began in his hometown with FK Rudar. At the age of 16, he made his debut in a first division match. Kenan Hasagi\u0107 plays for \u017deljez.page_content:
Kenan Hasagić biografija golmana koji je OSAM GODINA branio mrežu Reprezentacije BiH i istovremeno čuvao Željezničar.

Rođen je 1. februara 1980. godine u Kaknju. Priključuje se omladinskom sistemu Rudara, te sa 16. godina ostvaruje svoj prvi profesionalni nastup za seniorski tim. Jedna sezona u kojoj se ostvario 14 nastupa bila je dovoljna da mu austrijski Vorwärts Steyr da šansu.

Odlazak iz Kaknja ogromna pogreška?

Odlazak u Vorwärts za Hasagića nije bio uspješan. Dobio je ugovor na jednu godinu te iako je upisao 21 nastup nije uspio uvjeriti klub da mu produže ugovor.

Nakon Austrije Hasagić odlazi u Tursku kako bi igrao za Altay. Uspio je uvezati 42 nastupa i dvije sezone u turskom klubu bije nego što je ponovo ostao bez kluba.

Sa 20 godina i već dva kluba iza sebe Hasagić je odlučio da se vrati u rodnu BiH kako bi ponovo vratio formu koju je pokazivao kao omladinski igrač.

Potpisuje za Bosnu iz Visokog za koju upisuje 8 nastupa, te narednu sezonu vraća se u Kakanj kako bi igrao za Rudar. Uspješna sezona sa Rudarom privukla je pažnju Željezničara za koji potpisuje 1. jula 2002. godine.

Sa dolaskom u FK Željezničar, Hasagić je shvatio da mu je ovo odlična prilika te je vezao odličan nastup za odličnim nastupom.

U samo dvije sezone sa Željezničarom upisao je 55 nastupa i osvojio svoj prvi i jedini trofej u karijeru, a to je bio Kup BiH u sezoni 2002/2003.

Kenan Hasagić je definitivno jedan od najboljih golamana u historiji BH fudbala

Kvalitetni nastupi u Željezničaru su naveli tadašnjeg selektora reprezentacije BiH da mu da šansu, te Hasagić postaje prvi golman reprezentacije BiH.

Druga šansa u Turskoj koju nije propustio

Kenan Hasagić sredinom 2004. godine ponovo se seli u Tursku, ali ovaj put oblači dres Gaziantepspora, te postaje standardan u startnoj postavi.

Kroz tri godine sa Gaziantepsporom pokazao je koliko je konstantan i pouzdan golman te također da povrede ne utiču mnogo na njega. Upisao je 86 nastupa i postao favorit turskog kluba.

U 2007. godini čini svoj posljednji transfer u karijeri i prelazi u Istanbul Basaksehir. Iako se tada Basaksehir nije borio za titulu i nije predstavljao preveliku prijetnju velikoj trojci Hasagić se uvijek trudio da svoj klub stavi u najbolju moguću poziciju.

Činjenica da je Hasagić nakon završetka svoje karijere ostao u fudbalu kao trener golmana pokazuje koliko voli ovaj sport i koliko voli golmansku poziciju.

Odlazi iz Basaksehira kao omiljen među navijačima i svojim kolegama igračima. Zvanično se penzionisao 2012. godine nakon pet godina u klubu i upisanih 97 nastupa.

Kenan je u svojevremeno bio zaposlen u bh. premijerligašu Tuzla City kao trener golmana u stručnom štabu kojeg je predvodio trener Nermin Bašić. Prethodno je bio trener golmana Mladosti iz Doboja kod Kaknja te reprezentacije BiH.

Kenan Hasagić je ostavio neizbrisiv tragu u dresu reprezentacije BiH

Dres reprezentacije BiH je nosio 8 godina

Dakle, debi za seniorsku reprezentaciju Bosne i Hercegovine Hasagić je napravio u februaru 2003. godine na prijateljskom meču protiv Walesa koji je završen rezultatom 2:2.

No, prije dolaska u seniorsku reprezentaciju BiH, Kenan Hasagić je branio za U21 selekciju BiH za koju je upisao šest nastupa.

Od debija protiv Walesa 2003. godine, Kenan Hasagić je bio neizostavan dio spiska selektora Blaža Sliškovića. Dolaskom Fuada Muzurovića, Hasagić nije dolazio na okupljanja reprezentacije BiH, a njegovo mjesto zauzeo je Adnan Gušo.

Kenan se na gol reprezentacije BiH vratio u kvalifikacijama za EURO 2008 kada je branio na četiri meča.

Opet je uslijedila pauza od nacionalnog dresa, da bi među stative ponovo stao u prijateljskom meču protiv Japana 2008. godine.

Kenan Hasagić vs David Villa

Na otvaranju kvalifikacija za Svjetsko prvenstvo u Južnoj Africi 2010. godine, BiH je gostovala kod reprezentacije Španije gdje je poražena minimalnim rezultatom 1:0.

Na tom meču Kenan Hasagić urezao se u srca svih bh. navijača kada je poslao vrsnog napadača Davida Villu, ni manje ni više, nego po “ćevape”.

U baražu za odlazak na pomenuto takmičenje Hasagić je branio u obje utakmice, ali nažalost selekcija BiH je ostala bez plasmana na Mundijal 2010. godine.

Nakon toga, nastavio je Kenan Hasagić biti standardan u kvalifikacijama za EURO 2012. godine.

Posljednji susret u dresu reprezentacije BiH, Hasagić je odigrao u Parizu 2011. godine kada je BiH remizirala protiv Francuske 1:1, ali nažalost utakmicu je napustio nakon 45 minuta zbog povrede.

U tih devet godina u dresu reprezentacije BiH, Hasagić je branio 43 puta.

Za kraj vam donosimo kompilaciju najboljih poteza koje je Kenan Hasagić napravio u karijeri.

PREPORUČENO ZA VAS:

His football career began in his hometown with FK Rudar. At the age of 16, he made his debut in a first division match. Kenan Hasagić ( Bosnian pronunciation: [xâsaɡitɕ]; born 1 February 1980) is a Bosnian retired professional football goalkeeper[1] and current goalkeeping coach of Bosnian Premier League club Željezničar.

Club career [ edit ]

Hasagić's football career began in his hometown with Rudar Kakanj. At the age of 16, he made his debut in a first division match. He concedeed 5 goals. He was the most promising goalkeeper in Bosnia and Herzegovina, he played for youth selections and was later transferred to Austrian side Vorwärts Steyr.

After that, Hasagić was a member of Altay in Turkey but didn't see much first team football. He went back to Bosnia and played for Rudar Kakanj and Bosna Visoko. In 2003, he signed a contract with Željezničar. Here he found good form and even became first choice goalkeeper for the Bosnia and Herzegovina national team.

During the 2004–05 season, he moved to Turkey once again where he signed for Turkish Süper Lig side Gaziantepspor. In 2007, he moved over to another Turkish Süper Lig side in İstanbul Başakşehir. In 2012, Hasagić retired from football early after injuries shattered his career.

International career [ edit ]

Hasagić made his debut for Bosnia and Herzegovina in a September 2002 European Championship qualification match against Romania and has earned a total of 44 caps, scoring no goals.[2] His final international was an October 2011 European Championship qualification match against France.[3]

Managerial career [ edit ]

In August 2017, Hasagić became the new goalkeeping coach of Bosnian Premier League club Mladost Doboj Kakanj.[4] Two years later, on 2 November 2019, he announced that he left Mladost and that he will only be focusing on the Bosnia and Herzegovina national team.[5]

On 4 January 2018, after Robert Prosinečki was named the new head coach of the Bosnia and Herzegovina national team, it was announced that Hasagić became the new goalkeeping coach of the national team.[6] Hasagić left the national team in November 2019 with the sacking of Prosinečki.[7]

It was announced on 7 January 2020 that Hasagić took over the position of goalkeeping coach of another Bosnian Premier League club, Tuzla City, working alongside former national team teammate, good friend, and godfather Elvir Baljić, the club manager at the time.[8] He decided to leave the club in June 2021.[9]

On 9 July 2021, Hasagić became the new goalkeeping coach of his former club Željezničar.[10]

Personal life [ edit ]

In 1998, Hasagić met his future wife, Dijana, in Jablanica. They were married in 2000. They have three daughters together: Ilda, Iman and Inam. On 27 December 2009, Hasagić confirmed he divorced his wife Dijana after 9 years of marriage.

After his divorce, he has been in a long term relationship with a model, Aminka Sivac. He is 15 years older than her.[11] On 8 July 2019, Hasagić married Sivac. Former national team teammate Elvir Baljić was the best man at his wedding.[12]

Nekadašnji golman Plavih sa Grbavice danas je potpisao ugovor sa sarajevskim klubom i postao je novi trener golmana.

Hasagić je proteklu godinu i po proveo u Tuzla Cityju proveo Stigao je u januaru 2020. godine i očigledno da je došlo do zasićena i 41-godišnji trener se odlučio na odlazak.

Kenan Hasagić je ranije radio kao trener golmana u ekipi Mladosti iz Doboj Kaknja, te reprezentaciji Bosne i Hercegovine.

Nekadašnji golman Plavih i reprezentacije BiH, Kenan Hasagić, novi je trener golmana FK Željezničar. Posted by FK Željezničar on Friday, July 9, 2021

Dugo godina je Kenan bio broj jedan reprezentacije BiH za koju je nastupio 44 puta u periodu od 2002. do 2011. godine.

Klupsku karijeru ovaj nekadašnji čuvar mreže započeo je u kakanjskom Rudaru, a potom je igrao u Vorwartsu i Altayju.

U BiH se vratio 2001. godine u redove visočke Bosne, a zatim je preko Rudara došao u Željezničar.

Nakon dvije godine na Grbavici 2004. godine ponovo odlazi u Tursku, gdje je ostao narednih osam godina i gdje je nastupao za Gaziantepspor i Bašakšehir.

Kenan Hasagić ( Bosnian pronunciation: [xâsaɡitɕ]; born 1 February 1980) is a Bosnian retired professional football goalkeeper[1] and current goalkeeping coach of Bosnian Premier League club Željezničar.

Club career [ edit ]

Hasagić's football career began in his hometown with Rudar Kakanj. At the age of 16, he made his debut in a first division match. He concedeed 5 goals. He was the most promising goalkeeper in Bosnia and Herzegovina, he played for youth selections and was later transferred to Austrian side Vorwärts Steyr.

After that, Hasagić was a member of Altay in Turkey but didn't see much first team football. He went back to Bosnia and played for Rudar Kakanj and Bosna Visoko. In 2003, he signed a contract with Željezničar. Here he found good form and even became first choice goalkeeper for the Bosnia and Herzegovina national team.

During the 2004–05 season, he moved to Turkey once again where he signed for Turkish Süper Lig side Gaziantepspor. In 2007, he moved over to another Turkish Süper Lig side in İstanbul Başakşehir. In 2012, Hasagić retired from football early after injuries shattered his career.

International career [ edit ]

Hasagić made his debut for Bosnia and Herzegovina in a September 2002 European Championship qualification match against Romania and has earned a total of 44 caps, scoring no goals.[2] His final international was an October 2011 European Championship qualification match against France.[3]

Managerial career [ edit ]

In August 2017, Hasagić became the new goalkeeping coach of Bosnian Premier League club Mladost Doboj Kakanj.[4] Two years later, on 2 November 2019, he announced that he left Mladost and that he will only be focusing on the Bosnia and Herzegovina national team.[5]

On 4 January 2018, after Robert Prosinečki was named the new head coach of the Bosnia and Herzegovina national team, it was announced that Hasagić became the new goalkeeping coach of the national team.[6] Hasagić left the national team in November 2019 with the sacking of Prosinečki.[7]

It was announced on 7 January 2020 that Hasagić took over the position of goalkeeping coach of another Bosnian Premier League club, Tuzla City, working alongside former national team teammate, good friend, and godfather Elvir Baljić, the club manager at the time.[8] He decided to leave the club in June 2021.[9]

On 9 July 2021, Hasagić became the new goalkeeping coach of his former club Željezničar.[10]

Personal life [ edit ]

In 1998, Hasagić met his future wife, Dijana, in Jablanica. They were married in 2000. They have three daughters together: Ilda, Iman and Inam. On 27 December 2009, Hasagić confirmed he divorced his wife Dijana after 9 years of marriage.

After his divorce, he has been in a long term relationship with a model, Aminka Sivac. He is 15 years older than her.[11] On 8 July 2019, Hasagić married Sivac. Former national team teammate Elvir Baljić was the best man at his wedding.[12]
